thread.title: Royalty Crowned, while Cougars Football goes 6-0
thread.title_full: Royalty Crowned, while Cougars Football goes 6-0

title: Royalty Crowned, while Cougars Football goes 6-0
text: Royalty Crowned, while Cougars Football goes 6-0 Posted: 10/15/2015 06:41:21   06:48:14 PM MDT During halftime of the SCC Football game the 2015 Homecoming Royalty was crowned for both Revere and Julesburg. From Revere, King was Chance Dunker and Queen was Sierra Kline.   Cougars defeated the Merino Rams during the fair weathered homecoming game on Friday by a score of 52-8. Kicking off to Merino, the game started with hundreds of fans waiting to see whether the Cougars would stay undefeated. Chad Mikelson scoring the first touchdown on a pass play from Trey Walters, and the point after good. The Cougars led. Only a minute after the Cougars rushed for another TD and a two point conversion. Late in the first quarter they continued with two more touchdowns and a two point conversion to end the first quarter 29-0. Spending little time without scoring Cole McKinley rushed down for a 65 yard touchdown, and Chad Mikelson for the two point conversion, only putting more points on the board for Sedgwick County, 37-0. During halftime of the SCC Football game the 2015 Homecoming Royalty was crowned for both Revere and Julesburg. From Julesburg, King was Brandon Anderson and Queen was Alana Temple. (Courtesy photo) Before halftime the Cougars rushed another touchdown and two point conversion making the score 46-0. Beginning the second half, Merino kicked off to Sedgwick County and with a big kick return they were able to rush in for a touchdown by Mikelson. They held the Rams to a no score game until the fourth quarter with only two minutes to go when they were able to rush the field and get a touchdown and two point conversion. Scoring 30 in the first quarter set the Cougars up for the win. With a now 6-0, record and a No. 1 rank in the state of Colorado, they will travel to Caliche to play a A-8 Plains (8 Man) game on Friday, October 16. Advertisement During halftime of the game, homecoming royalty was announced. For Julesburg King was Brandon Anderson and Queen was Alana Temple, for Revere the homecoming royalty was Sierra Kline as Queen and Chance Dunker for King. The band also, performed at halftime for the large and proud Cougar crowd.
